[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Hash Collision] Can an attacker craft a malicious scheme input that generates a hash collision with an existing scheme ID in SchemeInfos mapping, allowing them to overwrite an existing scheme's configuration and steal profits? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [State Validation] Can CreateScheme() write a null or partially initialized Scheme object to SchemeInfos[schemeId], breaking invariants for subsequent operations that assume complete scheme data? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Race Condition] Can concurrent calls to CreateScheme() and AddBeneficiary() cause a race condition where SchemeInfos[schemeId] is read as null after scheme creation but before state commit, allowing duplicate scheme creation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Integer Overflow] Can TotalShares field in SchemeInfos[schemeId] overflow when AddBeneficiary() repeatedly adds beneficiaries with maximum shares, corrupting profit distribution calculations? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [State Poisoning] Can an attacker create a scheme with extreme values (e.g., CurrentPeriod = long.MaxValue) in SchemeInfos that causes DistributeProfits() to fail for all subsequent periods? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Authorization Bypass] Can ResetManager() update SchemeInfos[schemeId].Manager without properly invalidating ManagingSchemeIds for the old manager, allowing the old manager to retain control? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [State Consistency] Can RemoveSubScheme() delete a sub-scheme reference from SchemeInfos[parentId].SubSchemes without updating TotalShares, causing profit calculation mismatch? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [DOS Attack] Can an attacker register maximum number of sub-schemes in SchemeInfos[schemeId].SubSchemes, causing DistributeProfits() to exceed gas limits when iterating through sub-schemes? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Period Manipulation] Can ClaimProfits() incorrectly update SchemeInfos[schemeId].CurrentPeriod, allowing beneficiaries to claim profits from future periods not yet distributed? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [State Leak] Does SchemeInfos persist deleted schemes indefinitely, allowing attackers to drain storage resources by creating and 'deleting' schemes without actual state cleanup? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Circular Reference] Can AddSubScheme() create circular references (A→B→A) in SchemeInfos.SubSchemes, causing infinite loops during DistributeProfits() traversal? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Virtual Address Collision] Can two different scheme IDs map to the same VirtualAddress in SchemeInfos, causing token transfers to be routed to wrong schemes? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Manager Hijacking] Can an attacker frontrun CreateScheme() with identical input parameters to gain Manager role in SchemeInfos[schemeId] before legitimate creator? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Negative Shares] Can RemoveBeneficiary() cause SchemeInfos[schemeId].TotalShares to become negative when removing shares exceeding current total, breaking profit calculations? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Delay Period Exploit] Can attacker manipulate DelayDistributePeriodCount in SchemeInfos to force CachedDelayTotalShares accumulation without bound, causing storage exhaustion? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Token Symbol DOS] Can an attacker add unlimited token symbols to SchemeInfos[schemeId].ReceivedTokenSymbols, causing DistributeProfits() to run out of gas iterating through symbols? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [State Rollback] If DistributeProfits() partially updates SchemeInfos[schemeId].CurrentPeriod but fails mid-execution, can beneficiaries claim profits twice from the same period? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Precision Loss] Can decimal profit calculations in DistributeProfits() accumulate rounding errors in SchemeInfos.TotalShares over many periods, causing fund loss? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Scheme Resurrection] Can an attacker re-register a scheme ID in SchemeInfos after RemoveSubScheme(), inheriting orphaned profit details from previous scheme instance? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: SchemeInfos] [Invalid Period Count] Can creating a scheme with ProfitReceivingDuePeriodCount=0 in SchemeInfos bypass profit expiration checks, allowing infinite profit claims? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: DistributedProfitsMap] [Address Collision] Can virtual address computation for period-based profits collide in DistributedProfitsMap, causing profit distribution for period N to overwrite period M? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: DistributedProfitsMap] [Release Flag Bypass] Can ContributeProfits() write to DistributedProfitsMap[virtualAddr] even when IsReleased=true, allowing profit injection after distribution? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Profit/ProfitContractState.cs] [State: DistributedProfitsMap] [TotalShares Mismatch] Can DistributeProfits() write incorrect TotalShares to DistributedProfitsMap that doesn't match actual scheme shares, causing profit miscalculation? (High)
